author: Gaby Dalkin
title: Greek Lamb Meatballs with Tzatziki
ingredients: Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste
Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper to taste

instructions_list: In a medium bowl, combine lamb with all of the meatball ingredients. Form the meat into golf ball sized balls. Place the meatballs two inches apart on the baking sheet, and position the baking sheet a few inches from the heat source. Broil for about 5-7 minutes, turning once halfway through. Alternatively you can bake these at 425 for 8-10 minutes.
Combine the ingredients for the feta tzatziki. Serve alongside the meatballs for dipping.
description: These Greek Lamb Meatballs with Feta Tzatziki are truly what dreams are made of.

reviews.author: Fyod56
reviews.reviewBody:
Fantastic! Lovely soft tender tasty meatballs. And the sauce is amazing, although maybe next time I won't put a much lemon... the one I had was quite large. Family of 5 are 2x the recipe with couscous (made using chicken stock with grape tomatoes and lemon juice) and streamed brocolini.
Yum!

reviews.author: Aturchin
reviews.reviewBody: My meatballs needed more salt but overall a hit! That tzatziki is the best I’ve ever had and so easy, I made it in the few minutes it took to broil the meatballs!

reviews.author: Jenna
reviews.reviewBody: AMAZING recipe! I made a huge batch and froze half. My 4 kids loved it and I will make this again and again!

reviews.author: Erin
reviews.reviewBody: I made these as written and they were a hit around the family, from youngest to oldest. Being a soccer coach, I work in the afternoons and evenings. I made these during the day and kept them in the fridge, along with a simple tomato/cucumber/red onion salad. I also cut up pita and brushed with olive oil and sprinkled with salt. When I got home from training, I popped the meatballs in the oven for 5 min, followed by the pita for a min to toast it, and dinner was ready! Next time I will try with ground turkey or chicken. Thank you for a a quick, weeknight recipe that can be prepped in advance and goes beyond the normal pasta/casserole/slow cooker dish (not that I have anything against those!).

reviews.author: Pascale Poitras
reviews.reviewBody:
I want to give TEN STARS. I made the greek chopped salad as well. What a wonderful dinner. I did cheat and used tzatziki from Trader Joes and added the feta. I also did not broil the meatballs- instead roasted at high temp (and probably overcooked a tiny bit but who cares when the taste is so good).

YUM... had left overs for lunch yesterday. Oh so good.

reviews.author: Monika
reviews.reviewBody: Ooooh, this sounds like the perfect summer meal. Light and delicious!

reviews.author: Barbara
reviews.reviewBody: These are incredibly delicious.  We actually grill them in a grill basket and they are even better.

reviews.author: Liz
reviews.reviewBody:
I saw this recipe in the email today and made it for dinner tonight! It sounded great (and easy!) and it was both. So flavorful. This will definitely be added to the weeknight rotation.
The recipe directions are a little spare—it would be better to divide the ingredient list by meatball and tzatziki—but it works out as written.
